title: Increase file upload limit to 20MB with size warning

requirements.text: Increase the maximum file upload size limit from 2MB to 20MB for all file types in the frontend upload validation
acceptanceCriteria: Users can successfully upload files up to 20MB in size
The file size validation reflects the new 20MB limit
All file types are supported at the 20MB limit

requirements.text: Update the backend chunk size handling and storage to accommodate files up to 20MB, ensuring the existing 500KB chunk size can handle the larger total file size
acceptanceCriteria: Backend accepts and stores files up to 20MB without errors
Chunked upload process works correctly for files between 2MB and 20MB
File reassembly on download works for larger files

requirements.text: Add a warning message on the upload page that appears when users select or drag files larger than 15MB, informing them that the upload might take longer

quotes: Should there be any warning or confirmation when users try to upload files larger than, say, 15MB

acceptanceCriteria: Warning message displays when a file larger than 15MB is selected
Warning message clearly communicates that larger files may take longer to upload
Warning does not prevent the upload, just informs the user
Warning appears before the upload starts

requirements.text: Update the file size limit text displayed on the upload page from '2MB' to '20MB' to reflect the new limit
acceptanceCriteria: All UI text references to file size limits show '20MB' instead of '2MB'
Upload page displays the correct maximum file size

constraints: Keep the existing simple loading indicator without adding a progress bar
Maintain the existing 500KB chunk size for uploads
Do not change the file type handling - all file types remain supported
nonGoals: Adding a detailed progress bar or percentage indicator
Implementing different size limits for different file types
